Sentencas: The application of heterogeneous catalysis has an important role to play in the successful commercial development of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) technology.
Titulo: Internal reforming of hydrocarbon fuels in tubular solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In this paper, we present an SOFC that combines a catalyst layer with a conventional anode, allowing internal reforming via partial oxidation (POX) of fuels such as methane, propane, butane, biomass gas, etc., without coking and yielding stable power output.
Titulo: Internal reforming of hydrocarbon fuels in tubular solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The catalyst layer is fabricated on the anode simply by catalyst support coating and reforming catalyst impregnation.
Titulo: Internal reforming of hydrocarbon fuels in tubular solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The composition and microstructure of catalyst support layer as well as the catalyst composition was easily tailored to meet the demand of in situ reforming.
Titulo: Internal reforming of hydrocarbon fuels in tubular solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The usage of catalyst layer as an integrated part of the traditional SOFC will provide a simple low-cost power-generating system at substantially higher fuel efficiency and faster startups, and may accelerate the application of SOFCs through the direct use of hydrocarbon fuels.
Titulo: Internal reforming of hydrocarbon fuels in tubular solid oxide fuel cells
